content.description: Crouch start this problem. Traverse from right to left on the side of a low roof on a series of small crimps that get smaller and smaller. Left heel hooks, right toe hooks, and power endurance on small crimps are the key here.
content.location:
It is 10 yards to the left of the

Heel Hook Problem

on the south side of the big boulder.
It is on the right side of the small boulder.

content.description: Sit start with your right hand on a compression sidepull and your left hand on okay edge sidepull. Pull up, and do a dynamic move to big slice of bread-looking hold, then go dynamic with your left hand to good jug, and top out.
content.location: It is on the south side of the smaller of the big boulders.
It is on a small boulder in between the two large boulders.

content.description: Stand start with your left hand on a slopey sidepull and your right hand on a sloper, then move your left hand up to a good edge. Then heel hook next to your left hand, and shoot hard with your right hand to the right to a good edge. Match, and enjoy the next slab moves, then climb easy peasy to the top of the giant boulder.
content.location: It is located on the north side of the big boulder.

content.description: Crouch start under the roof with your right hand on an undercling pinch and your left hand on a low edge. Move Â your left hand up to a small gaston crimp. From there, your right hand goes out far to a blind compression edge, bring your left leg up to thigh scum the roof, and let your left hand fall into a compression hold. Then do a right hand dyno to a huge jug, match, and pull the lip using sidepulls and an awkward mantel.
content.location: It climbs out of the obvious roof.

content.description: Stand start with your left hand on a glassy sidepull and your right hand on an undercling. Move your left hand up to a slope,y two finger dish/pocket, and bump your right hand out to a big flake. After getting the flake, step your feet over, and match your left hand on the flake. Go up a few moves, then move your left hand out to a slopey dish. Heel hook the flake with your right foot, and reach up with your right hand to a good hold, then pull the lip.
content.location:
It is to the right of the

Heel Hook Problem

.

content.description:
Sit start this problem. Use the same start as

OG

, but then head right after the slice of bread jug. Traverse a few hand moves to another jug, then get your left foot on the slice of bread, and reach up to vertical crack with your right hand. Then move your left hand to the horizontal crack, stand up, and top out.
content.location:
It is to the right of the

OG Problem

.

content.description: Sit start this problem. Use powerful lockoffs on the wrong angle for the holds, then finish with easier climbing.
content.location:
It is on the left of the

OG Problem

.
